newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - May 6.
newsitem.headline: Australian Stocks to Watch Today - May 6.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

British publisher Pearson Plc is part of consortium called Australian Independent Newspapers (AIN) that is considering bidding for all or part of Australian publisher John Fairfax Holdings Ltd, The Australian newspaper said on Tuesday. Seven Network Ltd Chairman Kerry Stokes said he would not rule out looking at taking a stake in Fairfax, but that he would have to choose between Seven or Fairfax. Fairfax journalists also went on a half day strike in protest at the government's cross-media deliberations.

Upmarket retailer David Jones Ltd said on Tuesday its sales for the 13 weeks to April 26 fell 3.2 percent to A$290.5 million. David Jones said retail conditions remained difficult but it remained cautiously optimistic that a general retail upturn would occur in the first half of fiscal 1997/98.

Merrill Lynch said it downgraded Australian retailer Coles Myer Ltd to near-term neutral from accumulate. The brokerage firm said it kept the long-term rating as accumulate. Additional details were not immediately available.

Building products, sugar and aluminium group CSR Ltd said on Monday that it expected cost savings of A$30-35 million per year from its planned improvement programme in the timber products division. CSR announced earlier on Monday it planned to keep its timber products business which had previously been put up for sale through an international tender.
